runs.comm: full, swinging and wide of off stump, too wide, says the umpire
strong start from Gayle, he gets a half-volley and sends a punchy drive back past the bowler for four
oh dear! He's gone! Angled in and this ball doesn't swing at all, and rattles Gayle's stumps. The ball jagged back a little off the seam, Gayle has played the wrong line.
clipped away for a single
a touch too full there as Nannes looked for the yorker, Chanderpaul got to it on the full and clipped from just outside off through midwicket, well placed for a boundary
short and fast, Chanderpaul pulls a single forward of square leg
turned off his pads for a single to fine leg
Sarwan can't get this one away
swings in to the legs, it bobs up off the pad and they get through for a leg bye
lovely stroke from Chanderpaul, he uses Tait's pace and a little width outside off to help the ball on its way with a back-foot drive through point for four
bouncer to reply! Chanderpaul gets out of the way of that one
clipped off the pads through square leg
short of a length, Chanderpaul angles the bat and guides this one to third man
nudged to midwicket, can't beat the field
fuller, straighter, and Chanderpaul flicks the ball to fine leg
pushed away to mid-on and they consider a quick single, but Johnson's quick pickup and throw sends them back
nudged to cover, they can't find a run
yorker length outside off, driven wide of mid off, where Clarke dives across to make the stop
Sarwan backs off slightly and works it to cover
clipped away forward of square for a run
nicely played, too short from Watson and Sarwan crunches a pull through midwicket
Sarwan flashes outside off, can't make contact
guided away behind the wicket for a run
Chanderpaul walks across his stumps and tries to flick over fine leg, who has come up, but doesn't connect. Watson asks the question for lbw but it's denied by Rudi Koertzen, who called runs
pushed to mid-on, can't beat the field
short and wide of off, worked to point
bouncer this time, Chanderpaul gets under it and it's called a wide
flicked behind square leg, well played by Chanderpaul as he finds the boundary again
nudged to point, they think about a quick single but can't get it
short of a length, Chanderpaul drives to cover
oh, that's wonderful innovation, Johnson bowls a good line outside off and Chanderpaul walks all the way across and flicks it over short fine leg

the end of Chanderpaul! He's gone for the aerial drive over the bowler's head, doesn't quite time it and the ball gets a lot of air, David Hussey runs back from mid-on and takes a really well judged catch running with the flight
big appeal from Tait, he's got some nice inswing to Bravo there and wanted the lbw, Koertzen says it's slipping down leg
swinging in again, Bravo pushes to mid on
short of a length now, Bravo hops up on his toes to defend to midwicket
again Bravo is watchful, defending to leg
really good yorker, on line and swinging in, but it's well kept out by Bravo, who finds a run to mid on
almost through him, swinging in towards off stump and Sarwan gets a thick inside edge back onto his pads
clipped away off his pads to square leg

oh, what's happened here? The ball turns past the bat, Sarwan appears to be well in his ground but Haddin whips off the bails and is confident. The third umpire is called for and indeed Sarwan is moving his back foot, well inside the crease, but it's impossible to tell if his foot is just raised or not. His spikes look like they're grounded, so he's safe.
some turn again from Smith, Sarwan backs away and punches through cover
on the back foot and driven through point, Mike Hussey on the boundary makes a sliding save
pushed away for a single to the off side
goes over the top of cover, one bounce to the man in the deep
Sarwan gets this one fine, and fine enough to reach the boundary. Johnson was aiming at leg stump and the batsman got a tickle on it to beat fine leg
pushes a single to the off side
well, quite an expansive pull from Bravo there, he's really got under it and maybe even off the toe of the bat, it's bounced to the man at deep midwicket
slower ball outside off, beats the bat

oh, that's extremely unfortunate. What a shocking piece of luck for Dwayne Bravo. Sarwan drives fast and straight - too straight - as  the ball clips Johnson's fingers and rockets into the stumps at the non-striker's end with Bravo backing up out of his ground
on the pads, Sarwan turns the ball behind square
a bit too short, it's cut off the back foot through point
tossed up and nudged to leg, where there's a big gap, the bowler Smith has to hare off and chase. He ends up at midwicket but is quick enough to keep it to a single
pushed to the off side
Deonarine's inclusion hasn't helped West Indies, he's gone for the glory shot over deep midwicket but straight to the man on the boundary
pulled through midwicket
clipped through midwicket again, there's a big gap there with the men back on the boundary
driven to extra cover, can't beat the field
driven again, this time to long-off
wrong line from Johnson this time, down leg and called wide
gone, straightforward dismissal with a ball angled across Ramdin, who looks to dab the ball away and simply gets a thick edge behind
turned off the pads to backward square
left alone outside off stump
pushed to cover for a quick single
Pollard leans forward and defends watchfully
shorter ball, crunched to cover and they get a quick single, beating the throw to the bowler's end
driven down the ground to long-off
a nice, flat drive in the air wide of mid-off, very well played by Pollard
turns past the outside edge
some spin once again, Pollard defends
pushes a single to the off side
a bit short, driven to long-on off the back foot
clipped away through leg
tries to close the face on this one, leading edge heads out to the off side
defending once again, Pollard is content to be careful for now
and this time Pollard goes for it, he's got down on one knee to slog sweep, he had no intention of keeping that ball down and lifted it high over midwicket for six
pulled through leg for a single
turns outside off, Pollard cuts but can't beat the field

gone! Lovely piece of bowling from Smith, he's turned the ball just past the bat of Pollard, who is trying to get forward and work through leg, and Haddin whips the bails off, no need for the third umpire there
first ball! Smith is on a hat-trick! Tossed up on leg and turning back to off, Sammy has gone for the drive but straight back to the bowler, who takes a good catch
Taylor goes back and defends outside off
Taylor backs off and cuts this one uppishly forward of point
pulled fine behind square
angled in to Taylor, who can't connect and it strikes his pad
tries for the big one through leg, just gets it away edgily
punched through midwicket
on the back foot and tries to cut, can't beat the field
defended towards point once again
and it goes from bad to worse for West Indies. Sarwan, the last of the specialist batsmen, has tried to clear the boundary at long-off but has simply found the man in the deep
shouts of 'catch it' as it's driven airily between mid off and cover
perhaps an edge beats the man at slip
two wickets in the over for Dave Hussey, Taylor goes for a big swipe and gets a thickish edge that is taken at gully
driven through off, gets through for a single
Benn flashes outside off, Johnson beats the bat
solid in defence this time
shorter from Johnson, Benn gets something on the ball, gets it away through gully
dropped. Another drive in the air, Clarke at cover dives to his left and misses the chance with his left hand, not an easy catch but Clarke would take those more often than he'd spill them
full toss, might have slipped out of the fingers there as it's ballooned up above waist height on the hips, worked to fine leg and called a no-ball
turned to leg for another single
thick inside edge could easily have crashed into the stumps, but Benn gets away with it
angled across Miller, who pushes to cover
Miller flashes at this one and gets it through point for two
short ball, Miller ducks well under it
opens the face to guide the ball to third man
nudged to mid-on, can't beat the field
fast and straight, an inside edge onto pad
fast and wide down leg
swing tails in to Miller, who drives to deep cover
short down leg, Benn swivels for an ungainly pull that gets him a single to fine leg
more runs behind the wicket, a thick edge to third man
full and wide of off, through to the keeper
Tait and Haddin ask the question for caught behind, Benn jammed the ball down on a yorker and perhaps the noise of the bat on the ground got the Australians interested
similar ball, full and swinging away from the left-hander, who can't get bat on it
on the back foot, punched away to point
pushed to point and they get through for a quick single
beats the bat outside off
big Benn goes for the big shot! He gets hold of this pull and it's cleared the boundary!
beats the bat once again
gone, and that's the end of the innings. Watson goes full and straight and Benn can't get bat on that, it rattles his stumps
